docs.lead_paragraph: A vaginal gel that sharply reduces the risk of H.I.V. infection was found to be even more useful against genital herpes.

headline.seo: Gel Cuts Herpes Risk in Women, Study Finds
headline.main: Gel Cuts Women’s Risk of Herpes, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Gel Cuts Risk of Herpes Among Women, a Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published online by journal Cell Host and Microbes finds that a vaginal gel that sharply reduces a woman's risk of infection with the AIDS virus is even more effective against genital herpes, a much more common risk for young American women.
docs.snippet: A vaginal gel that sharply reduces the risk of H.I.V. infection was found to be even more useful against genital herpes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three books explore the brain’s astonishing capability, as well as its flaws and limitations.

headline.main: Is the Brain Good at What It Does?

docs.abstract: Christopher Chabris reviews books Brain Bugs: How the Brain's Flaws Shape Our Lives by Dean Buonomano, Now You See It: How the Brain Science of Attention Will Transform the Way We Live, Work and Learn by Cathy N Davidson and The Compass of Pleasure: How Our Brains Make Fatty Foods, Orgasm, Exercise, Marijuana, Generosity, Vodka, Learning and Gambling Feel So Good by David J Linden.
docs.snippet: Three books explore the brain’s astonishing capability, as well as its flaws and limitations.
